intro: Tribulus omanense var. yemenense, commonly known as the Yemen Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, helping to conserve water. It is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
